title: Macros vs static const values in Helpers.hh

content.raw:
There are a bunch of macros defined in Helpers.hh (like [IGN_DBL_MAX](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/src/93361a84c4fdb8a36b6852452e04361b439590cc/include/ignition/math/Helpers.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default#Helpers.hh-31)), but there are also static const variables (like [ignition::math::NAN_D](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/src/93361a84c4fdb8a36b6852452e04361b439590cc/include/ignition/math/Helpers.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default#Helpers.hh-210)). I assume the static const values are nicer than macros. Should we create matching static const values and point the macros there? Then maybe someday we could deprecate / remove the macros?

cc: @nkoenig
